org.jsapar.output
Class Outputter

java.lang.Object
  org.jsapar.output.Outputter

public class Outputter
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains methods for transforming a Document into an output. E.g. if you want to write the Document to a file you should first set the schema, then use a FileWriter and call the output(Document, java.io.Writer) method.

Author:
Jonas Stenberg

Method Detail

output

public void output(Document document,
                   java.io.Writer writer)
            throws JSaParException
Writes the document to a Writer according to the schemas of this outputter. Note that you have to add at least one schema to the instance of Outputter before calling this method.

Parameters:
document -
writer -

outputLine

public void outputLine(Line line,
                       Schema schema,
                       long lineNumberForSchema,
                       java.io.Writer writer)
                throws JSaParException
Writes the single line to a Writer according to the supplied schema for the supplied line.

Parameters:
line -
schema -
lineNumberForSchema - The line number for this schema. If you use multiple schemas in sequence, the number should only count the number of lines written with the supplied schema.
